result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rebecca Ruth Poirier is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rebecca Ruth Poirier was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Corrected JOC reflects Counts 1,3,4,5,6,7, and 8 being dismissed outright per form CR-245 signed on 2-12-2016 by Judge Jeffrey A. Wagner

miscConds.notes: -Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections by the end of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".

-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Comply with all Children's Court orders.

-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: -Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4/8/2016  at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.

$300 was posted to this case in error.  $300 will be moved to correct case 15CT1649.  15RM036906  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/09/2015

Defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier in court with attorney John c Glover.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison. Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 1 YEAR Extended Supervision.
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4/8/2016  at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Comply with all Children's Court orders.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections by the end of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Counts 1, 3,4,5,6,7,8 should be dismissed outright, not dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier in court with attorney John c Glover.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution.

Count 2 was amended to Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, 940.19(2), a Class I Felony. 

As to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, & 8:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8 dismissed and read-in.

As to Count 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier in court with attorney John c Glover.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. State unable to argue the motion at today's hearing. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 38.  Jury Trial and Motion hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Dallet.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Flanagan, Br. 04.

Defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Officer Kurt Saltzwadel.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #2013CF5023 that are attached to the complaint. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: 
KMP dob: 11/25/2005; MPV-dob: 12/17/2003; JP- dob: 4/5/2010; EP -dob: 11/2/2007. unless the contact is approved by the orders of Children's Court of Milwaukee County. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Rebecca Ruth Poirier in custody.  
Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
